intro: Stypandra virgata, commonly known as the slender stypandra, is a species of flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and often have a glandular surface, while its fruits are small, round, and contain a single seed. Stypandra virgata is often found in shrublands and is an important component of the local flora in its native range.
